snippet: A new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is the first major government report to show a consistent pattern of decline for low-income children.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention releases report that shows a consistent pattern of decline in obesity rates among low-income children; cause of decline remains a mystery, but researchers offer theories that include an increase in breast-feeding, drop in calories from sugary drinks and changes in food offered in federal nutrition programs for women and children.
lead_paragraph: A new report from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is the first major government report to show a consistent pattern of decline for low-income children.

headline.main: Poor Children Show a Decline in Obesity Rate
headline.print_headline: Poor Children Show a Decline In Obesity Rate

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
